segments.text: Have you tried, uh, Craig's List?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Uh, what?  Craig's List?  Oh the internet thing?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't know.  Isn't that-- that's all like escort services and things like that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No.  There's regular jobs on there.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't know.  I mean I've been looking for so long that I just figured that--  I mean, I think things like Monster are a lot more reliable than just some random free board.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Uh huh.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm just saying I have a friend that got a good job on it so I was just recommending it.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What kind of a job?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: He's like a manager for a theatre.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Really?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: He's like a house manager. Yeah.  It's a good job.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: He just...
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: you know what?  I heard about that job.  I applied for that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You did?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah.  I saw a posting at the theatre.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: He got it?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You've been looking for a job for a long time; that was a long time ago.  Right?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Hmm.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What did he do?  What was so great?  I don't understand why they would pick him over me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't know.  He had a really good resume I guess and--
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: A resume?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah.  Do you have a resume?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's kind of helpful when getting a job.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I just- I mean I call people up and I tell them what I'm good at.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well maybe we should sit down some time and you can just tell me all the stuff that you have done and I'll write it out.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't like- I don't like sending things in the mail.  I don't want my information out there.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No.  You can- or you can just bring it in person.  But they need, generally, something to see, you know, what kind of what that you've done, what kind of--
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm there in front of them.  I'm telling them what I'm good at.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah.  But the piece of paper helps, too.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Why?  It's a piece of paper.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No.  But it has an outline, you know.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I just don't want this paper trail, you know.  I just don't want things following me around, like-.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I know.  Okay.  Well, um. Maybe--
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's just-- You know, I've had this problem before.  You're not the first person to tell me that I need a resume but...
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Okay, yeah.  I would imagine.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: ..I just-..I just think it's kind of prejudiced and they are really discriminating against people who just aren't that way.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, sometimes you have to do things that you don't necessarily like to do to have a job. But the job affords you money, you won't have to be taking the bus right now.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: That's baloney, that's baloney.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Please.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: maybe get a car.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I just, you know, think you should try a little harder maybe.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: you think that you're better than me because I don't have a car?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I didn't say that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You know, you're riding the bus, too.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I am riding the bus, but by choice.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Why?  What choice?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: To save the environment, carpool.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You're saving the environment. mmhmm
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes.  One less car at a time.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Interesting.  That's fantastic.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Mmhmm.

segments.text: You know, you don't have to take out your frustration on me, you know, just because...

segments.text: I'm not frustrated.

segments.text: Who do you think you are?

segments.text: You are so high and mighty.  I just--

segments.text: I- I-I didn't-- okay.

segments.text: Oh.  I'm saving the environment. I'm riding this car because I- I want to.

segments.text: What?  No.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What? Oh.  So now you're...
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: The bus, I'm riding the bus because I want to.
